Detailed Description

The RemLib server interface provides functions to be used by player proxies to control and interact with the Remuco server.

Mainy this is

  • setting up a server with rem_server_up(),
  • notify the server about player status changes with rem_server_notify() and
  • shutting down the server with rem_server_down().

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _RemServer RemServer

The RemServer struct is an opaque data structure to represent a Remuco server.

Function Documentation

void rem_server_down ( RemServer *  rem  ) 

Shuts down a RemServer.

Disconnects all clients and frees all of the memory used by a RemServer.

Parameters:
rem a RemServer
Remarks:
The function returns immediately but the shutdown process may take some more milli seconds. When shut down is finished, RemPPCallbacks::notify will be called with the event REM_SERVER_EVENT_DOWN.

void rem_server_notify ( RemServer *  server  ) 

Notifies a RemServer about changes in a player.

The RemServer will later call RemPPCallbacks::synchronize to be up to date. This function is the opposite of rem_server_poll().

Parameters:
server a RemServer
Remarks:
Multiple calls to this functions in a very short time do not necessarily result in multiple calls to RemPPCallbacks::synchronize. The server will call once RemPPCallbacks::synchronize if the main loop is idle, independent of how many times this functions has been called before.

void rem_server_poll ( RemServer *  server  ) 

Instructs a RemServer to periodically check for player changes (by calling RemPPCallbacks::synchronize).

This function is the opposite of rem_server_notify().

Parameters:
server a RemServer
Remarks:
Once called, any further call to this function has no effect.

RemServer* rem_server_up ( RemPPDescriptor *  pp_desc,
RemPPCallbacks *  pp_callbacks,
const RemPPPriv *  pp_priv,
GError **  err 
)

Sets up a Remuco server.

The server will start working if a GMainLoop has been started for the GMainContext that is the default when calling this function.

Parameters:
[in] pp_desc Descriptor of the player proxy that starts the server. The server takes ownership of pp_desc and frees it (incl. contained strings) when rem_server_down() is called.
[in] pp_callbacks Callback functions to use by the server to interact with the player proxy. The server takes ownership of pp_callback and frees it when rem_server_down() is called.
[in] pp_priv Player proxy private data. This will be used as first parameter for the functions in pp_callbacks.
[out] err Location to return error in case something fails starting the server fails.
Returns:
A RemServer which must be used as first parameter for rem_server_notify() and rem_server_down(). If an error occurs NULL will be returned and err may be set.
